intro: Massonia huttonii, commonly known as the Hutton's massonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Massonia huttonii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
